It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
